etymologies: Middle English: from Old French respons or Latin responsum ‘something offered in return’, neuter past participle of respondere (see respond)

examples.text: without waiting for a response, she returned to her newspaper
we received 400 applications in response to one job ad

definitions: a written or verbal answer to a question in a test, questionnaire, survey, etc.
shortDefinitions: written or verbal answer to question in test

examples.text: an extended, jazzy piano solo drew the biggest response from the crowd
an honors degree course in Japanese has been established in response to an increasing demand

definitions: an excitation of a nerve impulse caused by a change or event; a physical reaction to a specific stimulus or situation.
shortDefinitions: excitation of nerve impulse caused by change or event

definitions: the way in which a mechanical or electrical device responds to a stimulus or range of stimuli.
shortDefinitions: way in which mechanical or electrical device responds to stimulus or range of stimuli

definitions: a part of a religious liturgy said or sung by a congregation in answer to a minister or cantor.
shortDefinitions: part of religious liturgy said or sung by congregation in answer to minister or cantor

definitions: a bid made in answer to one's partner's preceding bid.
shortDefinitions: bid made in answer to one's partner's preceding bid
